results.title: Australyaya Gelisiminhikayesi = Coming to Australia
results.creator_credit: Riza Guclu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Riza Guclu moved to Australia with his family, he was looking for a better life, like most immigrants. With that in mind, he learnt what he need to help him succeed.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (September 2007)
results.creator_credit: Terry Melvin, Robyn Colls, Maria McCarthy, Laura Brearley, David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Life changing events, the experience of Italian immigrants, tributes to loved ones. These four digital stories, created by members of the public and facilitated by ACMI staff, are a biographical record of things closest to the hearts of the participants.

results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Kalihgat
results.creator_credit: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.

results.title: Foot in the air
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.

results.title: Pitcha this : memories of Fitzroy : Foundation for Young Australians : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: May Andy, Marlene Scerri, Kelvin Onus-King, Howard Edwards, Frances Gallagher, Deborah Deacon, Arika Waulu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Seven Indigenous leaders in the community tell of growing up in Fitzroy. From disperate backgrounds, they have all become heavily involved with the activism and community spirit of Fitzroy in Melbourne, to grow into inspirational leaders for generations to come. Here they share their experiences and passions, as well as the families and communities they love.

results.title: The Yellow-box eucalypt
results.creator_credit: Des Surkitt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Des Surkitt pays tribute to the 27 fallen soldiers in one of the worst accidents in the Australian Army’s history. In Kapooka, an explosion during a training exercise, took the lives of all but one of the young soldiers. This event had a profound effect on Des, more so as he had just completed the training program the week before. Despite his good fortune, Des honours these lost men and reflects on why they have been forgotten by their own country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Des Surkitt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Des Surkitt pays tribute to the 27 fallen soldiers in one of the worst accidents in the Australian Army’s history. In Kapooka, an explosion during a training exercise, took the lives of all but one of the young soldiers. This event had a profound effect on Des, more so as he had just completed the training program the week before. Despite his good fortune, Des honours these lost men and reflects on why they have been forgotten by their own country.
